text: a day out in Birmingham for Malala
yousufzai this 16 year olds life was
transformed by the attack that nearly
killed her hello one year on I've been
spending time with her and her family so
what has been the hardest thing about
[Music]
she's much better now than she was but
your life changed in that in that one
moment no actually in seconds everyone's
life changed in that moment Malala was
only 11 when she first spoke out for
girls rights to go to school I will get
my education if it is in home school or
anyplace the world she knew was about to
disappear her home valley of Swat in
northern Pakistan came under the brutal
rule of the Taliban I was afraid of my
future I don't want to see any girl to
be ignorant and I don't want to see any
girl to be illiterate in future and
everyone wanted my future to be just
sitting in a room and to be imprisoned
in four walls and just cooking and
giving birth to children and I didn't
want to see my life in that way the
Taliban's control of the area was
short-lived but still malala's
determination would come at a cost
on the 9th of October last year she and
her friends were travelling home on
their school bus when it was stopped
there my daughter came in it was a fat
[ __ ] I don't know never supported a
loser cornucopias indirect riding clear
Malala was shot in the head
deliberately targeted by the extremists
today malala's become the face of the
world's 57 million out-of-school
children she has an influence few other
sixteen year olds can imagine and yet
she told me she still sees herself as an
ordinary teenager do you believe in a
dialogue with the Taliban whether in
your own country or in Afghanistan is
that the way forward do you think I
don't want to go deep in those issues of
terrorism because it's the job of the
government to do it it's a job of the
Ivana Stein government as well to do
this and I also request the Taliban that
they must stop it and they must do what
they want through dialogue they must
tell us what they want and killing
people and slaughtering people and
flogging people and blasting school it's
totally against Islam they are misusing
the name of Islam Islam tells us to be
peaceful Islam tells it it tells us
about Brotherhood this is not the true
Islam which the terrorists are showing
us
